thread.title: 12 Best Tailgating Vehicles for The 2015 Football Season
thread.title_full: 12 Best Tailgating Vehicles for The 2015 Football Season

title: 12 Best Tailgating Vehicles for The 2015 Football Season
text:
12 Best Tailgating Vehicles for The 2015 Football Season Written by: Jason Notte 09/12/15 - 10:01 AM EDT 
NEW YORK ( MainStreet ) â€“ If you have to leave your hermetically sealed Sunday sanctuary of satellite football packages, endless snacks, cheap beer and controlled climate to attend a football game, you may as well do so in style. 
Last season, NFL fans paid an average of $84 for tickets to the game and $31.50 for parking, according to Team Marketing Report . That's a whole lot to shell out just to stuff half a dozen friends into the family sedan, stick a far-undersized grill (don't be the one who brings the campstove) and use the rest of the cargo space left over for a handful of burgers and dogs and maybe a six pack of cans that has a Hail Mary chance of making it to gametime. Even if your car doesn't have the space and amenities to make a decent tailgate work, it might be worth your time to rent or even borrow a vehicle that does. More Headlines
